page.title: 07Local Memories
page.content: Pupils at Maghull C of E Primary School talked to two ladies who had some interesting memories of this area durung the recent past. Matthew Cowan talked to Mrs Currall who has lived here since her birth in 1915,is an "old girl" of the school and an ex_mayoress of Maghull.She remembers"She came to this school when she was 8,there used to be 180 pupils with separate entrances for boys and girls.Where the 3rd year block is now there used to be a playing field which was donated by the school manager.Part of the school was built in 1830 with additions in 1870.there are now very modern buildings for the pupils.In the way of shops there were mostly grocers that sold everything and anything.The founder of Meccano,Mr Hornby,lived in Maghull at the time.
